p: In the experimental hand pollinations, 51 of the 125 (41% [s.e. = 4.4%]) C. scandens pistillate flowers receiving heterospecific pollen were fertilized compared to only three (2.4% [s.e. = 1.4%]) of the C. orbiculatus flowers. Statistical comparison confirmed the difference between species. The model that included pistillate plant species identity greatly outperformed the null model (Î”AICc = 60.4, Akaike weight > 0.9999).
